description: Choose banana peels, pineapple cores, or nut milk pulp to turn up the flavour in this wonderful waste-free treat.
name: Fruity Cake Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180°C (Gas 4), and grease and line a 20cm round cake tin, or 900g loaf tin.
Place the coconut oil, syrup, and vanilla in a small saucepan. Melt over medium heat, then set aside to cool.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, almonds, baking powder, cinnamon, walnuts, and dried fruit.
Separate the egg yolks from the whites. Whisk the whites until they form soft peaks, and set aside.
Add the orange juice to the cooled syrup mixture, then gently beat in the egg yolks.
Pour the syrup mix into the flour mixture and stir until thoroughly combined. Very gently, fold in the egg whites with a spatula.
Pour the cake mix into the tin. Level out and sprinkle with flax seeds.
Bake the cake for 50-60 minutes, or until golden brown, firm to the touch, and skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.
Leave the cake to cool in the tin for 5 minutes. Turn out onto a wire rack, and allow to cool completely before serving. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
